result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander R. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any assessments/treatment ordered by the agent and follow through with all recommendations. 

Pay costs.  The Court has imposed costs in this case but remitted them in other concurrent matters this date.

Defendant to be eligible for expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation and to follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure when the time comes.

Credit in the event of revocation:  2 days.


Concurrent with: 16CM53 and 16CM46

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with 16CM53 and 16CM46, with huber, and stayed until on or before June 27, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.

Any costs still owed in this matter are ordered collected by the Clerk of Court as a civil judgment against the Defendant.  

Concurrent with: 16CM53 and 16CM46

from def re payments/payplan
from def re payments/payplan
Court, having reviewed Defendant's letter of June 9, 2016, states it is "moot"

Defendant Alexander R. Larson in court, in custody of the sheriff, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 16CM53, 16CM46, and 15CM156 called together for sentencing after revocation, together with status in 16CM58. Counsel state the agent's recommendation, which they also request in the revoked cases. 

Court follows the request and orders: 

16CM53, 9 months jail, with 80 days credit.
16CM46, 9 months jail, concurrent with 16CM53 (same 80 days to be indicated on JOC).
15CM156, 90 days jail, concurrent with 16CM53 and 16CM46 (same 80 days to be indicated on JOC).
Fees in all cases ordered as civil judgment.

Defense requests 4-day stay of these sentences.  Defendant to report on or before Monday, June 27, between 6-7 a.m.  Huber granted.

16CM58 - counsel indicate there may be new information; ask for further status.
from def requesting bail hearing on revocation matters.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Letter from def requesting bail hearing on revocation matters; Judge Sharp's response

Several cases called together:  16CM46 and 16CM53/initial appearance, 16CM36/adjourned initial, 15CM156/status, 16TR288/status.  Defendant Alexander R. Larson in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby 16TR288 will be dismissed and 16CM36 will be dismissed/read in; def will plead to count 1 in 15CM156, count 1 in 16CM53, and count 1 in 16CM46; remaining counts in those cases to be dismissed/read in.

Def pleads to counts 1 in each 15CM156, 16CM53, and 16CM46.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  Withheld for 2 years probation.  Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any assessments/treatment ordered by the agent and follow through with all recommendations.  Pay costs - 1 set imposed; the rest remitted.  Defendant to be eligible for expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation.

Credit in the event of revocation:  2 days in 15CM156, 3 days in 16CM53, and 1 day in 16CM46.

All other counts in the criminal cases dismissed/read-in.  16TR228 also dismissed.

Defendant Alexander R. Larson in court with attorney Gerald C. Opgenorth. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court appoints Atty. Opgenorth; had formerly appointed Atty. Lawrence but Atty. Lawrence can't represent.  Court reminds def that def will have to repay Richland County for the expense of Dean counsel.  Formal reading waived.  NG entered.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Adjourned initial appearance at 02-24-2016 11:00 am

1:42 p.m.  Defendant Alexander R. Larson in court. Prosecuting Atty John Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def states he called SPD and is not eligible; asks Court for Dean appointment.  Court questions def to determine eligible for Court-appointed counsel.  Court will appoint; states def to pay $50/mo towards costs; will be required to repay Richland County.  Payments to begin by 2/1.
Adjourned initial appearance at 01-20-2016 01:30 pm

12:07 p.m.  Defendant Alexander R. Larson in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def is present after turning himself in.  Court earlier ordered warrant.  Def states he worked overnight and then overslept.  Court continues this matter to 1:30 today, directing def to call SPD office between now and then with a report back to the Court at 1:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
10:24 a.m.  Defendant Alexander R. Larson not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA requests warrant.  So ordered.
Adjourned initial appearance at 01-20-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Alexander R. Larson in court, in custody, after turning himself in on fta warrant. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin; asks for bond to be reinstated on fact that def turned himself in.  Court reinstates bond and sets new date of Jan. 20th at 10 ; instructs def to contact SPD for eligibility determination.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.
per RCSD dispo sheet - def turned himself in - in custody now waiting for bail hrg

Defendant Alexander R. Larson in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court reads the charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to counsel.  Def has been provided with number for SPD office.  Court asks for def's plea.  Def pleads not guilty.  Def states he plans to contact SPD; wants counsel.  Adj. to 9/30 at 9.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
